thread.title: Twitter Users Slam Fox News for Ignoring Flynn Resignation as Other Networks Go All In on Coverage
thread.title_full: Twitter Users Slam Fox News for Ignoring Flynn Resignation as Other Networks Go All In on Coverage

author: Abid Rahman, Jennifer Konerman
title: Twitter Users Slam Fox News for Ignoring Flynn Resignation as Other Networks Go All In on Coverage
text:
Login to download Twitter Users Slam Fox News for Ignoring Flynn Resignation as Other Networks Go All In on Coverage 9:59 PM PST 2/13/2017 by Abid Rahman , Jennifer Konerman Bloomberg/Getty Michael Flynn CNN, MSNBC went wall-to-wall with coverage while Fox News' hosts largely ignored the breaking news from the White House. 
Michael Flynn's resignation as President Donald Trump's national security adviser has sent shockwaves from Washington to Hollywood and CNN and MSNBC wasted no time in going wall-to-wall with coverage. 
Fox News, on the other hand, was slammed by viewers online for seemingly giving only perfunctory attention to the seismic news coming out of the White House. 
Flynn resigned Monday after a growing scandal on his links with Russia, saying in a resignation letter that he held numerous calls with the Russian ambassador to the U.S. during the transition and gave "incomplete information" about those discussions to Vice President Mike Pence. 
While CNN and MSNBC seemed to go all in on their Flynn coverage when the news broke, CNN's Don Lemon leading a panel of analysts and contributors in a discussion about the resignation, then handing off coverage to Jim Acosta. 
Fox News covered the news for a brief few moments before returning to the night's episode of The O'Reilly Factor. Later, at the top of the hour the network recapped the news before airing Tucker Carlson Tonight , which featured interviews with Milo Yiannopoulos protesters and supporters of the controversial Breitbart editor. The network continued to cover the Flynn resignation through Twitter and its on-air news ticker. 
See some of the reactions below. If @FoxNews doesn't report Flynn there's gonna be millions of Red Hats who wake up tomorrow believing he's still NatSec Adviser. — Beau Willimon (@BeauWillimon) February 14, 2017 Flynn resignation on every news channel except @FoxNews . I guess they fairly balance @CNN & @MSNBC coverage with a blindfold and earplugs. — michael dybeck (@DybeckM) February 14, 2017 DOWN GOES FLYNN @FoxNews however is covering Ivanka Trump being dropped by Sears and Kmart and labeling it as discrimination. #comeonson — Michael Ealy (@MichaelEaly) February 14, 2017 Hey @FoxNews maybe interrupt @oreillyfactor to tell people about Flynn's resignation instead of talking about Meryl Streep. — Ingrid Michaelson (@ingridmusic) February 14, 2017 That moment when @FoxNews is talking about Ivanka Trump's products instead of covering Michael Flynn's resignation. But @CNN is #FakeNews ? — Alyssa Birchfield (@alyssambirch) February 14, 2017 So Natl. Security Adviser Mike Flynn resigns, coverage by @CNN and @MSNBC . @FoxNews - crickets! SAD! — Byron Hester (@HesterByron) February 14, 2017 Sorry I was wrong about @foxnews they now changed to report on Piers Morgan and JK Rowling feud while Flynn has resigned. #fakenews — Andrew Pierce (@apierce227) February 14, 2017 Michael Flynn resigned six hours ago. @FoxNews still refuses to put it on their website. They are in total disbelief #GnashingOfTeeth
